title: ‘At six weeks, my parents handed me over to a white Essex couple’
text:
British actor Adewale Akinnuoye-Agbaje is the star of several Hollywood blockbusters, having appeared in The Bourne Identity with Matt Damon, and in the Thor franchise alongside Chris Hemsworth. Roles in Game of Thrones, and as “a cannibal with rage issues” in Suicide Squad, the 2016 superhero film with a cast including Will Smith, Margot Robbie and Cara Delevingne, have only cemented his standing. But it was his role in the hit TV series Lost – as the drug runner-turned-priest, Mr Eko – that has left the deepest impression on his fans.

“I’ve been to corners of the world where people don’t speak a word of English,” says Akinnuoye-Agbaje, who says he is now routinely referred to as “Triple-A”...
description: British actor Adewale Akinnuoye-Agbaje is the star of several Hollywood blockbusters, having appeared in The Bourne Identity with Matt Damon, and in the Thor franchise alongside Chris Hemsworth.
